title: Leonard Nimoy present - Mr. Spock's Music From Ou (1967
description:
Leonard Nimoy present - Mr. Spock's Music From Outer Space (1967)

What is a Leonard Nimoy? To most people, he's Spock. To others, he's also the man who brought us the love-it-or-hate it "The Ballad of Bilbo Baggins" and the inadvertently funny covers of pop songs found on Rhino Records' Golden Throats. What many people don't know is that Leonard Nimoy was an overnight smash when his records hit the late 60s-early 70s music scene.

The public tends to think of Nimoy in his Spock persona… calm, collected, and logical. But Nimoy as a man was groovy, hip, keenly interested in social causes, and a man with a good sense of humor who didn't let fame go to his head. These sensibilities are on display in the series of records he made for Paramount Pictures' subsidiary, Dot Records, from 1967 to 1970.

Tracklist
(01) [Leonard Nimoy] Theme From Star Trek.mp3
(02) [Leonard Nimoy] Alien.mp3
(03) [Leonard Nimoy] Where Is Love.mp3
(04) [Leonard Nimoy] Music To Watch Space Girls By.mp3
(05) [Leonard Nimoy] Beyond Antares.mp3
(06) [Leonard Nimoy] Twinkle, Twinkle Little Earth.mp3
(07) [Leonard Nimoy] Mission Impossible.mp3
(08) [Leonard Nimoy] Lost In The Stars.mp3
(09) [Leonard Nimoy] Where No Man Has Gone Before.mp3
(10) [Leonard Nimoy] You Are Not Alone.mp3
(11) [Leonard Nimoy] A Visit To A Sad Planet.mp3
(12) [Leonard Nimoy] Highly Illogical.mp3
(13) [Leonard Nimoy] The Difference Between Us.mp3
(14) [Leonard Nimoy] Once I Smiled.mp3
(15) [Leonard Nimoy] Spock Thoughts.mp3
(16) [Leonard Nimoy] By Myself.mp3
(17) [Leonard Nimoy] Follow Your Star.mp3
(18) [Leonard Nimoy] Amphibious Assault.mp3

I dont usually post this kind of content but I gotta throw a curve every now and then
